sentences.en: " Then why do you always look so downcast? "
sentences.cn: “ 那么为什么你的脸色总是这样阴沉 呢 ? ” 觉新关心地问道.

sentences.en: An unhappy life made her downcast.
sentences.cn: 不愉快的生活使她沮丧.

sentences.en: Ashamed of his mistake, he stood with downcast eyes.
sentences.cn: 羞于他的错误, 他眼睛垂视地站着.

sentences.en: Barbara looked increasingly downcast as defeat loomed.
sentences.cn: 当败象已呈时，芭芭拉看上去越来越沮丧。

sentences.en: Chu Kuei - ying did not reply, but sat with crimson cheeks and downcast eyes.
sentences.cn: 朱桂英涨红了脸不回答, 眼睛看在地下.

sentences.en: Don't look sad and downcast, as you are doing - he'll be angry.
sentences.cn: 别做出难过丧气的样, 象你现在这样一他会生气的.

sentences.en: He felt very strange, very humiliated, very downcast.
sentences.cn: 他觉得很奇怪, 很耻辱, 很颓丧.

sentences.en: He pretended to be very downcast.
sentences.cn: 他故意做出失望的样子说.

sentences.en: He was not at all downcast.
It looked on downcast faces, the images of mournful hearts.
sentences.cn: 人们脸上也是阴沉沉的,愁眉不展, 反映着凄楚的心情.

sentences.en: Mr. Pan had been downcast for the last few days.
sentences.cn: 这几天潘先生无聊极了.

sentences.en: Penelope sat silently, her eyes downcast.
sentences.cn: 佩内洛普一言不发地坐着，目光低垂。

sentences.en: She was silent, her eyes downcast.
Stubbs the plasterer was much downcast at this dreadful edict.
sentences.cn: 泥水匠斯塔布斯对这道使人敬畏的“法令”十分沮丧.

sentences.en: With downcast eyes I explained that I was not the person they all thought I was.
sentences.cn: 我双目低垂地解释说,我并不是他们都以为的那个人.

trans.tran_cn: 情绪低落的，向下的，颓靡
trans.tran_en: sad or upset because of something bad that has happened

trans.tran_cn: 倒台；俯视的目光；向下转换
